item.title: Quick Math Help
item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

[quote=“ThatOneServer, post:9, topic:175162”]Lucia was 5. Her aunt was 20(four times her age)
Now, 10 years later, she is 15. Her aunt is 30.[/quote]
Wrong. People age linearly. I posted the full bloody solution… Why would you doubt it?

=================================================================

It is a simple system of linear equations.

a = lucia
b = aunt

The first phrase tells you that her aunt is twice as old as her, so:
2a = b

The second phrase tells you that 10 years ago (lucia’s age - 10), her aunt was four times that age (4 times (a - 10)).
4(a - 10) = b

Since b equals to both of the equations, we merge the equations and solve.
2a = 4(a - 10)

2a = 4a - 40

-2a = -40

2a = 40

a = 40/2

a = 20

Lucia is 20 years old now. Her aunt is 40 years old.

Easy peasy. Let me know if you need any more help.

========================================================

Edit: Oh, you can read the question two ways…

The second way:
2a = b

4(a - 10) = b - 10

4a - 40 = b - 10

4a - 30 = b

4a - 30 = 2a

2a = 30

a = 30/2

a = 15

Lucia’s current age is 15 years old. Her aunt is 30 years old. Ten years ago, she was 5 years old and her aunt was 20. You can read this question two ways, it’s phrased very poorly.
